title: Rodent of unusual size (dNetHack)

| A rodent of unusual size:* is an [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal").
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                   |

A **rodent of unusual size**, r, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears as part of the [Convict](/wiki/Convict "Convict") patch incorporated in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"). The rodent of unusual size is a [medium](/wiki/Medium "Medium")-sized [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal") that is among the stronger [rodents](/wiki/Rodent "Rodent") in the [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class"), and can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). Like other [rats](/wiki/Rat "Rat"), Convicts can pacify or tame them by [chatting](/wiki/Chatting "Chatting") to one.

A rodent of unusual size has a single bite attack.

## Generation

Randomly generated rodents of unusual size are always hostile. An [enormous rat](/wiki/Enormous_rat_\(dNetHack\) "Enormous rat (dNetHack)") can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into a rodent of unusual size.

Rodents of unusual size appear among the random r that are part of the first quest [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") for the [Madman quest](/wiki/Madman_quest "Madman quest") and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated for [Madmen](/wiki/Madmen "Madmen") above the locate level of the branch.

Rodents of unusual size also appear among the random r that are part of the first quest monster class and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the quests of the following roles:

- [Convict quest](/wiki/Convict_quest "Convict quest")
- [Healer quest](/wiki/Healer_quest "Healer quest")
- [Pirate quest](/wiki/Pirate_quest "Pirate quest")
- [Tourist quest](/index.php?title=Tourist_quest/dNetHack\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Tourist quest/dNetHack (page does not exist)")

## Encyclopedia entry

Rodents of unusual size? I don't think they exist.  
\[ The Princess Bride, directed by Rob Reiner,  
written by William Goldman ]

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Rodent_of_unusual_size_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit)*

Rodent of unusual size (dNetHack)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
r rodent of unusual size
Difficulty 8
Attacks Bite 2d6 physical
r rodent of unusual size
Difficulty 8
Attacks

Bite 2d6 physical

Base level 7
Base experience 120
Speed 8
Base AC 4
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 500
Nutritional value 200
Size medium

A rodent of unusual size:

  • is an animal.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can be seen through infravision.

A rodent of unusual size, r, is a type of monster that appears as part of the Convict patch incorporated in dNetHack and notdNetHack. The rodent of unusual size is a medium-sized carnivorous animal that is among the stronger rodents in the monster class, and can be seen via infravision. Like other rats, Convicts can pacify or tame them by chatting to one.

A rodent of unusual size has a single bite attack.

Generation

Randomly generated rodents of unusual size are always hostile. An enormous rat can grow up into a rodent of unusual size.

Rodents of unusual size appear among the random r that are part of the first quest monster class for the Madman quest and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated for Madmen above the locate level of the branch.

Rodents of unusual size also appear among the random r that are part of the first quest monster class and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the quests of the following roles:

  • Convict quest
  • Healer quest
  • Pirate quest
  • Tourist quest

Encyclopedia entry

Rodents of unusual size? I don't think they exist.
[ The Princess Bride, directed by Rob Reiner,
written by William Goldman ]

This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

A '''rodent of unusual size''', {{monsym|rodent of unusual size}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears as part of the [[Convict]] patch incorporated in [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]]. The rodent of unusual size is a [[medium]]-sized [[carnivorous]] [[animal]] that is among the stronger [[rodent]]s in the [[monster class]], and can be seen via [[infravision]]. Like other [[rat]]s, Convicts can pacify or tame them by [[chatting]] to one.

A rodent of unusual size has a single bite attack.

==Generation==
Randomly generated rodents of unusual size are always hostile. An [[Enormous rat (dNetHack)|enormous rat]] can [[grow up]] into a rodent of unusual size.

Rodents of unusual size appear among the random {{white|r}} that are part of the first quest [[monster class]] for the [[Madman quest]] and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters randomly generated for [[Madmen]] above the locate level of the branch.

Rodents of unusual size also appear among the random {{white|r}} that are part of the first quest monster class and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the quests of the following roles:

* [[Convict quest]]
* [[Healer quest]]
* [[Pirate quest]]
* [[Tourist quest/dNetHack|Tourist quest]]
